alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 2:33AM EDT until September 30 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Norfolk/Portsmouth, Newport News and Hampton/Poquoson Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 1 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Shallow flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline resulting in a low threat of property damage. Expect up to one foot of water above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks and lawns near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 30/10 AM 4.8 2.0 1.3 2 MINOR 30/11 PM 4.6 1.8 1.6 2 MINOR 01/11 AM 5.1 2.3 1.6 2 MINOR 02/12 AM 4.2 1.4 1.3 1-2 NONE 02/12 PM 4.6 1.8 1.2 2 MINOR 03/12 AM 3.9 1.1 1.2 2 NONE CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
